metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8979 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the parsePresentationContext function in storescp in DICOM dcmtk-3.6.0 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a long string sent to TCP port 4242.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8979` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dcmtk - 3.6.0-15+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
dcmtk-www - 3.6.0-15+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
libdcmtk2 - 3.6.0-15+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dcmtk package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.0-15+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
